response.message: Maybe reopen Stack Exchange shop to sell tee-shirts, tee-mugs and fluffy unicorns? With so much money at your disposal, you shouldn't worry anymore about low sales. :-)

The "new sites" link near the end of this blog post needs view=list to work properly for those of us who generally view in grid format.
Done. -Ed
Hurrah, I have a job. Surely that comes with one of those snazzy offices?
Opening up your office for a few hours a month in Denver would actually be pretty awesome.  There are some local groups that might be interested in something like that.
Thanks for answering our questions - that Q&A was very nice.
Is this an "In The Pale Moonlight" reference?!

@Shadow - It's not the relatively low volume of sales that makes the store prohibitive, it's the sheer amount of person-time that goes into fulfilling those orders and managing everything. One package to say .. New Delhi .. that FedEx is claiming to be undeliverable (even though they're wrong) can eat up an hour easily. Combine that with issues like wrong size, wrong site design, mug broke during shipping, etc - it's almost a full-time job.

Not opposed to that, but we've got to get some other stuff hammered together a bit better first.
You can see the Godzilla Netscape anamited logo, and others here: http://www.jwz.org/blog/2011/12/the-secret-history-of-aboutjwz-aboutmozilla-and-the-netscape-throbbers/

@TimPost
Not that I can complain but  can't you delegate that to a third party that'd take a cut (like CafePress, not sure if it's still a thing)?

Lol nevermind people are already selling them :D

http://www.cafepress.com/mf/92667838/you-bet-i-have-my-stackoverflow-gold_mugs?productId=1377034343

There is a pretty good windows phone app on stackapps.  But I've never used the android/ios ones so I guess I don't know what I'm missing

http://stackapps.com/questions/4354/stack-mate-explore-your-stackexchange-accounts-and-get-notified-about-unread-m
There's a spider hidden in George Washington's hair?

Re color issues: it's probably not that difficult to cover a good fraction the panels people are using
- Retina & non-retina Macs
- A TN 1366x768 PC laptop
- A TN 1920x1080 monitor
- An IPS 1920x1080 monitor
- An IPS PC laptop, pick an HD resolution
- A 3200x1800 laptop (these are pentile panels that have frequently reported issues with yellows)

Beautiful sentiment, but the goal **get every programmer a better job** -- do you really want to be that massively disruptive?  What about your programmer-colleagues?  Akin to marriage.stackexchange.com claiming a goal to get every married person a better spouse.

Man, I hope I'm never married to my job.

But where's dating.stackexchange.com?  I'd be all for having better options in the dating pool.
Congrats on that pile of cash! Good job of keeping it real.
